results.title: Import-Csv (Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility) - PowerShell
results.description: The Import-Csv cmdlet creates table-like custom objects from the items in CSV files. Each column in the CSV file becomes a property of the custom object and the items in rows become the property values. Import-Csv works on any CSV file, including files that are generated by the Export-Csv cmdlet. You can use the parameters of the Import-Csv cmdlet to specify the column header row and the item delimiter, or direct Import-Csv to use the list separator for the current culture as the item delimiter. You can also use the ConvertTo-Csv and ConvertFrom-Csv cmdlets to convert objects to CSV strings (and back). These cmdlets are the same as the Export-Csv and Import-Csv cmdlets, except that they work with data from the pipeline instead of from files. If a header row entry in a CSV file contains an empty or null value, PowerShell inserts a default header row name and displays a warning message. Starting with PowerShell 6.0, Import-Csv now supports the W3C Extended Log File Format.

descriptions.content: The Import-Csv cmdlet imports the CSV strings from the Processes.csv file.
The Import-Csv cmdlet imports the CSV strings from the Processes.csv file.
If the specified character doesn't match the actual delimiter in the CSV data, Import-Csv can't parse each column into distinct properties.

results.title: Convert CSV files to Excel workbooks - Office Scripts
results.description: Learn how to use Office Scripts and Power Automate to create .xlsx files from .csv files.

descriptions.content: Learn how to use Office Scripts and Power Automate to create .xlsx files from .csv files.

results.title: Bulk upload to add or create members of a group - Microsoft Entra ID
results.description: Add group members in bulk by using a comma-separated values (CSV) file.

descriptions.content: Understand the CSV template Download and fill in the bulk upload CSV template to successfully add Microsoft Entra group members in bulk.
Note CSV template formats vary by operation.
Example CSV file Here's an example of a completed CSV file ready for upload, matching the current template format.
